data.title: Historical Information
data.text:
BOARD MEMBERS HISTORY

HISTORY OF THE DUVAL COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS

The County was formed August 12, 1822.

The Board of Public Instruction was appointed on March 1, 1869. The first Board was appointed by the State Board of Education. Nominations were from

the State Superintendent of Public Education, and consisted of 5 members.

The School Board was organized on November 24, 1869 – Alonzo Huling, Chairman.

The second Board was established in 1889. This Board was elected, and has been elected since that time.

(Information from County Archives of Florida – Number 16 – Duval County – Page 123 – Book No. F352 H673)

The Judge of Probate acted as County Superintendent of Schools prior to 1869. They were:

Date Appointed Judge of Probate

July 26, 1845 William F. Crabtree

July 26, 1849 Felix G. Livingston

October 30, 1855 Benjamin Hopkins

January 31, 1857 Oscar Hart

November 24, 1857 Richard B. Rushing

October 29, 1859 Chandler S. Emery

November 8, 1861 Francis S. L’Engle

October 26, 1863 Francis J. Wheaton

December 21, 1865 H. Doggett

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

SUPERINTENDENTS
